text:
I read that early this morning, but I just don't get it. I know they run
per-core benchmarks just as Windows folks do. And no one ever noticed? It's
difficult to believe...

metadata.topic: RE: Linux kernel hardcoded to a maximum of 8 cores for the past 15 years and nobody noticed
metadata.subject: [patchmanagement] RE: Linux kernel hardcoded to a maximum of 8 cores for the past 15 years and nobody noticed
metadata.email_text_original:
I read that early this morning, but I just don't get it. I know they run
per-core benchmarks just as Windows folks do. And no one ever noticed? It's
difficult to believe... -----Original Message----- From:
patchmanagement@googlegroups.com On Behalf Of Steve Yates Sent: Wednesday,
November 15, 2023 1:11 PM To: patchmanagement Subject: [patchmanagement] Linux
kernel hardcoded to a maximum of 8 cores for the past 15 years and nobody
noticed
https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fthehftguy.com%2F2023%2F11%2F14%2Fthe-linux-kernel-has-been-accidentally-hardcoded-to-a-maximum-of-8-cores-for-nearly-20-years%2F&data=05%7C01%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C7ad602d681ad48705d8e08dbe611899f%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638356736550594450%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C2000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=R%2BgS9aqv74QtE91YPoE92xfww65bfZW9ibsoEKAi94o%3D&reserved=0
"This commit added automated scaling of scheduler settings with the number of
cores in 2009. It was accidentally hardcoded to a maximum of 8 cores." -- You
received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups
"PatchManagement" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving
emails from it, send an email to patchmanagement+unsubscribe@googlegroups.com.
To view this discussion on the web visit
